form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Moran introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to expand authorities for intergovernmental support agreements for the Department of Defense, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expanding Defense Community Partnerships Act.

section.header: Expansion of authority of Department of Defense for intergovernmental support agreements

subsection.text: Section 2679 of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (4), by striking provided in subsection (a) and inserting under paragraph (1); and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: In entering into or carrying out an intergovernmental support agreement under paragraph (1), the Secretary concerned or the State, local, or tribal government, as the case may be, may agree to partner or collaborate with another Federal agency or agencies to provide, receive, or share installation-support services.

in subsection (c), by striking the first sentence and inserting the following: To pay the costs of installation-support services under an intergovernmental support agreement under this section, the Secretary concerned may use funds available to the Secretary concerned for operation and maintenance, research, development, test, and evaluation, procurement of ammunition, or military construction and may use non-appropriated funds available to the Secretary concerned.;
in subsection (e)(4), by striking September 30, 2025 and inserting September 30, 2030; and
in subsection (f)(1), by inserting , including those for repair, construction, maintenance, or operation of a facility, after for its own needs.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Defense shall carry out a pilot program under which the Secretary may enter into not more than one intergovernmental support agreement under section 2679 of title 10, United States Code, for each of the Army, the Navy, and the Air Force for a term not to exceed 20 years, notwithstanding the limitation under subsection (a)(2)(A) of such section.
